abstract: A Taiwanese animation studio famous for its fanciful recreations of news events recently found itself competing with CNN. Now the pioneers in news animation want to tackle more serious subjects.
snippet: A Taiwanese animation studio famous for its fanciful recreations of news events recently found itself competing with CNN. Now the pioneers in news animation want to tackle more serious subjects.
lead_paragraph: In the hours after the capture of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, as news organizations struggled to put the raw, graphic footage showing his last minutes alive into context, a Taiwanese animation studio famous for its fanciful recreations of news events suddenly found itself competing with CNN. In Atlanta as in Taipei, animators were asked to illustrate what reportedly happened in Libya that day just before Colonel Qaddafi was captured and the cameras started rolling.

headline.main: As News Animations Go Mainstream, Taiwanese Pioneers Try Playing It Straight
